title: GT 4.0 OGSA-DAI (Tech Preview): System Administrator's Guide

section.title: Introduction
section.para: This guide contains installation and configuration information for system administrators installing the Workspace Management Service. It explains how to install, configure and test the installation.

section.title: Building and installing
section.para: Describe how to build and install the Workspace Management Service.

OGSA-DAI is not built and installed as part of the standard Globus Toolkit installation. You will find the installation bundle in the contributions directory. You will need to install the Java WS-Core from the Globus distribution.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: The deployment and use of the OGSA-DAI WSRF distribution will be easier if you are already familiar with:

itemizedlist.listitem: OGSA-DAI concepts and terms: Reading the user's guide included in the OGSA-DAI distribution should provide you with this information.
WS-Addressing concepts and terms: an introduction to WS-Addressing is available at http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/specification/ws-add.
Web Services Resource Framework (WSRF) concepts and terms: the WSRF specifications can be found at http://www.globus.org/wsrf.

section.title: Prerequisite Software
section.para: To use OGSA-DAI WSRF you will need the following software:

itemizedlist.listitem: Java 1.4.0: OGSA-DAI WSRF has been tested on this version of Java though may work with other Java 1.4.x flavours.
Jakarta ANT 1.5: see http://ant.apache.org.

Globus Toolkit Java WS Core
This provides a Java-based implementation of WSRF and is available at: http://www-unix.globus.org/toolkit/downloads/development. Information on Globus Toolkit 4.0 can also be found at: http://www-unix.globus.org/toolkit/docs/development/4.0-drafts/GT4Facts.

section.title: Data Resource Drivers
section.para: You will also need to download the corresponding database drivers for any data resources you wish to expose using the OGSA-DAI WSRF distribution. Data resources and drivers that have been tested against OGSA-DAI are:

itemizedlist.listitem:
MySQL
MySQL Connector J/2. Available from: http://www.mysql.com. Note that if you use version 4.1.x of MySQL you will need version 3.1 of the driver. Required JAR: mysql-connector-java-XXX.jar where XXX is the version of the driver.

DB2
DB2 JDBC Driver. Available from http://www.ibm.com/software/data/db2. Required JARs: db2jcc.jar, db2jcc_licence_cu.jar.

Oracle
Oracle JDBC Drivers for Java 1.2+. Available from http://www.oracle.com. Required JAR:classes12.zip - rename as classes12.jar.

Xindice 1.0
Xindice 1.0. Available from http://xml.apache.org/xindice. Required JARs: xindice.jar, xmldb-xupdate.jar, openorb-1.2.0.jar.

Microsoft SQL Server
MS SQL Server JDBC driver. Available from http://www.microsoft.com. Required JARs: mssqlserver.jar, msbase.jar, msutil.jar.

Postgres
Postgres JDBC driver. Available from http://www.postgresql.org. Required JAR: pgXXXX.jar where XXXX is the version of the driver.

Derby
Apache Derby driver. Available from http://incubator.apache.org/derby/. Required JAR: derby.jar.

HSQL
HSQL 1.7.x driver. Available from http://hsqldb.sourceforge.net Required JAR: hsql.jar.

Exist
Exist 1.0 Beta 2 driver. Available from http://exist.sourceforge.net/ Required JARs: exist.jar, xmlrpc-1.2-patched.jar.

section.title: Building OGSA-DAI WSRF
section.para: This section describes how to build OGSA-DAI WSRF.

section.title: Insert the Prerequisite JAR Files
section.para: First, download the prerequisite JAR files (listed above):

itemizedlist.listitem: jakarta-oro-2.0.7.jar
lucene-1.4-final.jar
xmldb.jar

section.para: and put these into the OGSA-DAI distribution's lib directory.

section.title: Download and Compile GT4
section.para: Now, you need to download and compile Globus Toolkit 4 Web Services Core. The GT4 instructions tell you how to do this.

section.title: Build OGSA-DAI WSRF

itemizedlist.listitem:
Set a GLOBUS_LOCATION environment variable to point to the location of your GT4 distribution. For example, under UNIX, enter:
$ export GLOBUS_LOCATION=/path/to/Globus/directory

Run the following from within the OGSA-DAI distribution directory:
$ ant makeGar

section.para: OGSA-DAI WSRF will then be built. Note that before you can use OGSA-DAI you must configure it. This is covered in the deployment section.
